intro: Commiphora mildbraedii subsp. dodomaensis, commonly known as the Dodoma myrrh tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to Tanzania. It belongs to the Burseraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic bark and resinous secretions. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually simple, alternate, and have a leathery texture, while its flowers are small and inconspicuous. The resin produced by this species has been used traditionally for various purposes, including medicinal and aromatic applications.
